results.title: The Cider House rules
results.creator_credit: Lasse Hallstrom, Richard Gladstein, Miramax Films and Film Colony
results.brief_description: John Irving won an Academy Award for his script to the film which is based on his acclaimed novel of the same name. Set in the lush green landscape of mid-century North East United States, ‘The Cider House rules’ stars Tobey McGuire as Homer, a bright young man who has spent his whole life in St. Cloud’s Orphanage. The institution’s doctor and leader, Wilbur Lynch (Michael Caine), wants Homer to take over his duties in the orphanage. But Homer wants to see more of the world and to experience life outside the safety of St. Clouds. He goes on the road and begins work as a farm-hand in an apple orchard. There he experiences love for the first time, but he is also introduced to the harsh realities of life. Witnessing incest and betrayal for the first time in his life, Homer has to rethink his self-righteous beliefs about single motherhood, adoption and abortion. Though the film deals with controversial subjects and themes, it is a revisionist piece of filmmaking. The sharp lyrical cinematography is by Oliver Stapelton, while Irving’s script and Hallstrom’s direction is classical in structure. But though its mise-en-scene may be nostalgic, in suggesting the darker forces at play in the social order of post-World War II North America, ‘The Cider House rules’ never allows its emotional resonances to slip into sentimentality. The cast is uniformally excellent and Michael Caine won an Academy Award for his performance.

results.title: The Christmas tree
results.brief_description: This is a traditional Ukrainian folktale, based on a story by Michaelo Kochubinsky, set in the 19th century. The story concerns eleven year old Ivanko, his parents, a mysterious old man and the “special” Christmas tree that tests the family’s faith and draws them together.

results.title: The Christmas dream
results.creator_credit: K Zeman, B Zeman and Czechoslovak Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A fantasy in which a little girl’s toys come to life in a dream - the toys being played by puppets. (The film is noteworthy for the excellence of the puppet animation in the original material - for American distribution introductory and concluding sequences have been added to the film by Castle Films, USA.). Music only - no language.

results.title: Detention
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Four students are being kept in detention for one hour after school. They are bored and cannot wait to be allowed to leave. The clock ticks slowly on. Finally the clock strikes four and they are free to go.

results.title: The Chord sharp = Der Falschspieler = Le Faux joueur
results.creator_credit: Alastair McIlwain, Joachim Kreck, Ian Moo Young, Volker Kriegel and Hand Made Films
results.brief_description: A superbly animated non-narrated look at the making of a rock superstar. Details, in images that can be easily read by children, the way in which the hype process both creates a media personality and effectively dehumanizes that personality at the same time. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Crushed
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A young man, in his disgust at watching a terrible film entitled “Fear”, makes the dramatic decision to run it over several times with his car.

results.title: The Chinese girl = La Chinoise
results.creator_credit: Jean-Luc Godard, Parc Film, Anouchka Films and De La Gueville
results.brief_description: This experimental non-linear work, about five students who embrace Maoism, heralded the second wave of Godard’s filmmaking - The Revolutionary. Spending the summer in the bourgeois surrounds of a borrowed flat, the students become immersed in the doctrine of Chairman Mao’s Little Red Book, discussing methodologies (which include terrorism and assassination) to overthrow governmental systems. Heralded by some as groundbreaking cinema that subverted popular notions of filmmaking (recall Godard’s famous quote: “A story should have a beginning, a middle and an end, but not necessarily in that order”), “La Chinoise” also confounded many Godard admirers with its obscure polemic. Cast includes: Juliet Berto, Jean-Pierre Leaud, Anne Wiazemsky and Blandine Jeanson.

results.title: The Champions. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Janet Leissner, Peter Katadotis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Rene Levesque and Pierre Elliott Trudeau, Canada’s chief political protagonists, are the focus of this two part documentary. Part one covers their early years up to 1967. Using rare photos, newsreel footage and interviews with close political colleagues, the film provides the background to the struggle between the two men and their ideologies. In doing so, it helps to illuminate a great crisis in Canadian history. Awards: Toronto

results.title: The Chinese connection = Fist of fury
results.creator_credit: Lo Wei, Raymond Chow and National General Pictures
results.brief_description: This martial arts action film stars Bruce Lee as Chen Chen, returning to his former school in early 20th Century Shanghai to learn that his beloved teacher has been murdered. While probing the man’s death and seeking vengeance, Chen discovers that a drug smuggling operation, a rival school, and simmering racial tensions between Chinese and Japanese locals are factors in the nefarious dealings at his school and in his master’s murder. Poorly dubbed into English. Cast includes: Bruce Lee, Robert Baker, Miao Ker Hsiu.

results.title: The China syndrome
results.creator_credit: James Bridges, Michael Douglas and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: An explosive contemporary thriller starring Jane Fonda, Jack Lemmon and Michael Douglas. Fonda is cast as a news reporter who covers a story on nuclear energy and films a startling and controversial ‘incident’. Lemmon is a veteran engineer whose integrity makes him a target for murder. Douglas is a newsreel cameraman determined to discover what his film footage, which the station refuses to air, really means. The China Syndrome is acknowledged as one of the best made films dealing with such highly controversial subject matter.
